Name: Talairach Deterministic Atlas
Description: Digitized version of the 1988 Talairach and Tournoux atlas with automated coordinate-based labeling system. Uses a hierarchical volume-occupancy labeling scheme (VOTL - Volume Occupancy Talairach Labels) organized into five levels: Hemisphere, Lobe, Gyrus, Tissue type, and Cell type. The atlas has been registered to MNI152 space using correcting affine transforms for improved accuracy.
Curators: Research Imaging Center, University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio
HowToAcknowledge: Please cite: Lancaster JL, Woldorff MG, Parsons LM, Liotti M, Freitas CS, Rainey L, Kochunov PV, Nickerson D, Mikiten SA, Fox PT. Automated Talairach Atlas labels for functional brain mapping. Human Brain Mapping 10:120-131, 2000; Lancaster JL, Rainey LH, Summerlin JL, Freitas CS, Fox PT, Evans AC, Toga AW, Mazziotta JC. Automated labeling of the human brain: A preliminary report on the development and evaluation of a forward-transform method. Human Brain Mapping 5:238-242, 1997.
Funding: NIH Human Brain Project (NIMH grant 5 P01 MH52176-07, NLM grant)
ReferencesAndLinks: Lancaster JL, Woldorff MG, Parsons LM, Liotti M, Freitas CS, Rainey L, Kochunov PV, Nickerson D, Mikiten SA, Fox PT. Automated Talairach Atlas labels for functional brain mapping. Human Brain Mapping 10:120-131, 2000
